instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 2936 v 3115 displays
threads.message: Since I am at a loss with the 2936 not having backlight, I am wondering if the customer who replaced the screen, bought the wrong one.  This is a 2011 2936, is there a difference between the 3115 screen? How about iterations of the same device (2011 v 2012 etc...).  Also, do 3115 connectors work on the 2936? I cant seem to find any to source, using this phrase.

threads.title: 2936 v 3115 displays
threads.message:
left is 2012 , right is 2011
I hope this will help

connectors are different. LCD are same from 2009-2012
[IMG type="full" width="200px"]http://i64.tinypic.com/14kctj6.jpg[/IMG]

threads.title: 2936 v 3115 displays
threads.message: Really..... now you tell me that the screen was changed. That would of course be the first suspect now.

threads.title: 2936 v 3115 displays
threads.message: they all use the same LCD, 2012 uses a different LCD cable and different LCD cable with same pinout.
